abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel urges city to pay $4.9 million under proposed settlement of lawsuit filed by family of Philip Coleman, who died in police custody after having adverse reaction to anti-psychotic drug in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Chicago would pay $4.9 million under a proposed settlement of a lawsuit brought by the family of a man who died in police custody.

headline.main: Illinois: $4.9. Million Settlement Possible in Death
headline.print_headline: Illinois: $4.9 Million Settlement Possible in Death

snippet: Chicago would pay $4.9 million under a proposed settlement of a lawsuit brought by the family of a man who died in police custody.
